message:
Hi guys.

I have this board that was liquid damaged and someone just cleaned it and left me small traces to follow for repair. When i got it was overheating U8295 which i replaced just to see but the same issue again. I measured all contact and it came to be a full short on pin 5 and 6 on U8295. Followed the line couldn't find the short but i injected voltage and the short was removed and now diode mode reading in the line is 0.112 tested with 2 different meters. With injected voltage now doesn't show any short but with external power supply shows 0.081amps pull. Any suggestions please?

Thanks :cool:

Which voltages do you get on the board?
5V, or 20V on USB-C meter?

And nothing else?
Please, post some voltages/signals from power on sequence...
I'll update tomorrow probably was very busy today. Thank you

PPBUS_G3H - 12.6v
PPBUS_HS_CPU - 12.6v
PPBUS_HS_GPU - 12.6v
PPBUS_HS_OTH5V - 12.6v
PPBUS_HS_OTH3V3 - 12.6v
PPBUS_S4_HS_TPAD - 12.6v


PP3V3_G3H - 3.4v
PP3V0_G3H - 3.1v
PPVCC_S0_CPU - 0v
PPVCCIO_S0_CPU - 0v
 Just stuck at 20v on usb-c meter

Please, do NOT waste time checking voltages in the same power rail.
Do you really think the voltage will change after miliohm resistors???

Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?
Hi. Getting back to this old issue. Found a short on L2950 goes on the pin 2 side. I injected 0.9volts it's overheating the U2800... next step?
Also i'm getting 20v on all ports when plugged in with the usb tester.

Which is the exact vale of that short (ohm scale)?
Did you compare with good board?
If really low, then you need to remove U2800.

Yes after removing the U2800 short is gone. If i get from another board will it work please? 

Thanks
There is a separate TBT ROM chip, not sure if U2800 has internal firmware board dependant.
